content.body: If you have tests impacted by partitioned BroadcastChannel, what would be the best replacement at this point in time? The stash feature? Is there a client-side wrapper for that available today?
`stash` was more about retaining shared state than message-passing, no?
content.formatted_body: stash was more about retaining shared state than message-passing, no?

content.body: or maybe there's a replacement for those? https://github.com/web-platform-tests/rfcs/pull/90
ooh I needed these a while back when we were porting prerender out of `BroadcastChannel`.
content.formatted_body: ooh I needed these a while back when we were porting prerender out of BroadcastChannel.

content.body: zcorpan: thanks, that's very helpful. I'm surprised the cross-origin-opener-policy tests haven't yet been rewritten to make use of those, but I suppose I can take a look at that.
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: thanks, that's very helpful. I'm surprised the cross-origin-opener-policy tests haven't yet been rewritten to make use of those, but I suppose I can take a look at that.

content.body:
```
data:text/html,<!DOCTYPE%20html><script>document.addEventListener('keypress',console.log);</script>
```

Chrome & Firefox don't fire a `keypress` event for the `Escape` key. WebKit seems to. I'm curious if there's a spec detail that represents this, or if this is something known?
content.formatted_body:
data:text/html,<!DOCTYPE%20html><script>document.addEventListener('keypress',console.log);</script>

Chrome & Firefox don't fire a keypress event for the Escape key. WebKit seems to. I'm curious if there's a spec detail that represents this, or if this is something known?
